title: openfoam-org does not concretize due to incompatible default flex (2.6.3) version

labels.name: fixed-by-new-concretizer
labels.description: An issue that is resolved by the ASP-based concretizer

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
### Steps to reproduce

```
[ec2-user@ip-172-31-1-92 spack]$ spack  install openfoam-org
==> Error: An unsatisfiable version constraint has been detected for spec:

    flex@2.6.3%gcc@7.3.1+lex~nls arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
        ^bison@3.7.6%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
            ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
            ^m4@1.4.19%gcc@7.3.1+sigsegv arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                ^libsigsegv
            ^perl@5.34.0%gcc@7.3.1+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                ^berkeley-db@18.1.40%gcc@7.3.1+cxx~docs+stl arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                ^bzip2@1.0.8%gcc@7.3.1~debug~pic+shared arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                ^gdbm@1.19%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                    ^readline@8.1%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                        ^ncurses@6.2%gcc@7.3.1~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                            ^pkgconf@1.7.4%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
                ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@7.3.1+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512
        ^findutils@4.8.0%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-amzn2-skylake_avx512


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    scotch~int64~metis+mpi


scotch requires flex version :2.6.1,2.6.4:, but spec asked for 2.6.3
```

However, `spack  install openfoam-org^flex@2.6.1` works just fine.


### Error message

_No response_

### Information on your system

Skylake
Amazon Linux2 

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [X] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
